notes.short: A 7-segment numeric display, with one or more digits.

packets.name: instance_name
packets.description:
A friendly name that describes the role of this service instance in the device.
It often corresponds to what's printed on the device:
for example, `A` for button A, or `S0` for servo channel 0.
Words like `left` should be avoided because of localization issues (unless they are printed on the device).

packets.name: status_code
packets.description:
Reports the current state or error status of the device. ``code`` is a standardized value from 
the Jacdac status/error codes. ``vendor_code`` is any vendor specific error code describing the device
state. This report is typically not queried, when a device has an error, it will typically
add this report in frame along with the announce packet. If a service implements this register,
it should also support the ``status_code_changed`` event defined below.

packets.name: status_code_changed
packets.description: Notifies that the status code of the service changed.

packets.name: digits
packets.description:
Each byte encodes the display status of a digit using, 
where bit 0 encodes segment `A`, bit 1 encodes segments `B`, ..., bit 6 encodes segments `G`, and bit 7 encodes the decimal point (if present).
If incoming ``digits`` data is smaller than `digit_count`, the remaining digits will be cleared.
Thus, sending an empty ``digits`` payload clears the screen.

```text
 - A -
 G   B
 |   |
 - F -
 |   |   -
 E   C  |DP|
 - D -   -
```

packets.name: brightness
packets.description: Controls the brightness of the LEDs. ``0`` means off.

packets.name: double_dots
packets.description:
Turn on or off the column LEDs (separating minutes from hours, etc.) in of the segment.
If the column LEDs is not supported, the value remains false.

packets.name: digit_count
packets.description: The number of digits available on the display.

packets.name: decimal_point
packets.description: True if decimal points are available (on all digits).
